definitions.definition: The act of flowing; a continuous moving on or passing by, as of a flowing stream.

definitions.example: Languages, like our bodies, are in a continual flux.

definitions.definition: A chemical agent for cleaning metal prior to soldering or welding.
definitions.example: It is important to use flux when soldering or oxides on the metal will prevent a good bond.

definitions.definition: The rate of transfer of energy (or another physical quantity) through a given surface, specifically electric flux, magnetic flux.
definitions.example: That high a neutron flux would be lethal in seconds.

definitions.definition: A disease which causes diarrhea, especially dysentery.
Diarrhea or other fluid discharge from the body.
The state of being liquid through heat; fusion.

definitions.example: You have to flux the joint before soldering.
